qas.question: Who was Paul VI in favor of cooperating with in the translation of the bible?
Who asked Paul VI for permission to cooperate with Protestants to translate the bible?
In what year did Paul VI officially declare his support of a cross faith translation of the bible?
What group of Christians did Paul VI support and approve of cooperation with?

context: Paul VI supported the new-found harmony and cooperation with <a3_0>Protestants<a3_0/> on so many levels. When <a1_0>Cardinal Augustin Bea<a1_0/> went to see him for permission for a joint Catholic-Protestant translation of the Bible with <a0_0>Protestant Bible societies<a0_0/>, the pope walked towards him and exclaimed, "as far as the cooperation with Bible societies is concerned, I am totally in favour." He issued a formal approval on Pentecost <a2_0>1967<a2_0/>, the feast on which the Holy Spirit descended on the Christians, overcoming all linguistic difficulties, according to Christian tradition.
